front.title: Teredo: Tunneling IPv6 over UDP through NATs

abstract.t: We propose here a service that enables nodes located behind one or several IPv4 NATs to obtain IPv6 connectivity by tunneling packets over UDP; we call this the Teredo service. Running the service requires the help of 'Teredo servers' and 'Teredo relays'; the Teredo servers are stateless, and only have to manage a small fraction of the traffic between Teredo clients; the Teredo relays act as IPv6 routers between the Teredo service and the 'native' IPv6 Internet.
